intro: Galium hypotrichium subsp. nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white to pale yellow flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest understories. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other Galium species.
